reference.description: bz#1934236: CVE-2021-20328 mongo-java-driver: client-side field level encryption not verifying KMS host name

remediation.description:
To apply this update just follow standard installation procedure
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_integration/2021.q1/html/installing_debezium_on_openshift/installing-debezium-connectors-debezium

note:
An update for Debezium MongoDB connector is now available for Red Hat Integration.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

MongoDB is a higly-scalable document database. The Debezium MongoDB connector includes Java driver to access a MongoDB database.
Security Fix(es):
* mongodb-driver: mongo-java-driver: client-side field level encryption not verifying KMS host name (CVE-2021-20328)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
